column4: it may have to do with the routes, you can probably tick the vpn to not be the default gateway. which means you will have to specify which ip's/netbklocks are routed through the vpn
I kind of need it to be used as default gateway.  In windows its used as default as well.  I guess it's not doable in my situation.  thx
if it is your default gateway then it should break any current connections you have
I guessed it would, but it doesnt affect them in windows, no idea why
either windows tracks the connection, or it does not set the default gateway properly
I thought it wasnt working properly in windows, but then I checked whatismyip and did other tests, it was default.
